settings.question: What should I prioritize when buying a diamond?
settings.answer: Pay particular attention to the guidelines regarding diamonds with respect to carat, cut, clarity, and color and always go for a certified diamond.

settings.question: How do I choose the right engagement ring?
settings.answer: Take into account your partner's taste, pick an appropriate diamond of superior quality and a tough base like platinum or 18K gold.

settings.question: Are lab-grown diamonds as good as natural diamonds?
settings.answer: Definitely. Man-made diamonds are made up of the same elements as natural diamonds and are equally bright and lustrous, yet they are less expensive and eco-friendlier.

settings.question: What’s the best way to measure ring size?
settings.answer: Put a ring sizer on your finger or take the measurement of your finger by a professional. Do not try to guess since resizing may alter the shape and ornaments of the ring.

settings.question: Why is diamond certification important?
settings.answer: Certification is a way of ensuring the quality of a diamond and its authenticity thereby assuring the buyer of the quality of the diamond purchased.

settings.question: How do I set a budget for jewelry?
settings.answer: First establish a hierarchy for any factors that would be relevant whenever budget allocation is needed, such as metal type, diamond size, and geometric complexity.

settings.question: What’s the difference between 14K and 18K gold?
settings.answer:
• 14K gold consists of 58.3% gold and is tougher.
  • 18K gold has 75% of pure gold hence darker in color but is softer.

settings.question: Can I customize my jewelry?
settings.answer: In fact, Stienhardt & Stones among other jewelers do make custom design engagement rings, wedding bands and other jewelry.

settings.question: How do I ensure the jewelry I buy is ethically sourced?
settings.answer: Look for such certifications that address these issues such as conflict free diamonds and responsible sourcing of metals.

settings.question: What is the benefit of professional jewelry cleaning?
settings.answer: Professional cleaning is undertaken to enhance the aesthetic appeal of your jewelry and prevents attention for any damages for instance losing stones.
